DataElement.preferredName: Nucleic Acid Absorbance at 260 And Absorbance at 280 DNA Purity Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents the sample ratio of nucleic acid absorbance at 260 nm and 280 nm, used to determine a measure of DNA purity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nucleic Acids Absorbance at 260nm And Absorbance at 280nm DNA Purity Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Type of substance that may be described as a linear sequence of nucleosides typically linked through phosphate esters._The quantity of 260nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The quantity of 280nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A family of macromolecules, composed of various moiety: purines, pyrimidines, phosphoric acid, and a pentose, either d-ribose or d-deoxyribose. Nucleic acids in the form either DNA or RNA was found in the chromosomes, nucleoli, mitochondria, and cytoplasm of all cells, and in viruses.  Nucleic acids are the major players in controlling cellular function and heredity. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Type of substance that may be described as a linear sequence of nucleosides typically linked through phosphate esters.

Property.preferredName: Absorbance at 260nm And Absorbance at 280nm DNA Purity Ratio
Property.preferredDefinition: The quantity of 260nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The quantity of 280nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.:A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: The quantity of 260nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The quantity of 280nm light that is not transmitted through a substance or solution.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 5 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
